name: Anko (Sweet Red Bean Paste)
author: Anonymous
summary: The paste is used to hold together pastries, cakes, and other dishes that come from Japan, most commonly desserts.
ingredients: 4 cups water, divided, or as needed
directions: Place beans in a saucepan and cover with 2 cups water; bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes
Place drained beans in a clean saucepan and cover with 2 to 3 cups water
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover the saucepan, and simmer, adding more water as needed, until beans are soft and can be crushed between your fingers, 1 1/2 to 2 hours
Stir beans and sugar together in a saucepan over medium-high heat
Cook, stirring constantly, until sugar melts and beans form a loose, shiny paste, about 10 minutes
Immediately transfer the paste to a container to cool
